data.title: Maya Wong - Women's Basketball
data.meta_description: Maya Wong (12) Guard  - REDSHIRT SENIOR YEAR (2023-2024): Started all 34Â games for the Redbirds...Scored in double-figures in a career-best 21 contests...Recorded
data.text:
REDSHIRT SENIOR YEAR (2023-2024): Started all 34 games for the Redbirds...Scored in double-figures in a career-best 21 contests...Recorded her first-career 20-plus point outing with a career-high 23 points Dec. 19 vs Saint Louis...Reached 20 points for just the second time in her career with a 20-point performance Feb. 29 at Southern Illinois...Led Illinois State in the scoring category on a career-best six occasions, after doing so just one time heading into the 2023-2024 campaign...Surpassed 1,000 career points March 7 vs Murray State, becoming the 32nd player in program history to do so...Became the 7th player in program history to hit 300 career free throws, finishing the season ranking fourth in program history with 326 career free throws...Hit a career-best 132 free throws, which ranks 5th on Illinois State's single-season free throws list...Shot 132-153 (86.3) from the free throw line, leading Illinois State for the third straight season in that category, becoming the first player in program history to lead the Redbirds in free throw percentage over three consecutive seasons...Hit a career-best 11 free throws Nov. 24 vs UT Arlington and Feb. 17 at Valparaiso, including a perfect 11-for-11 against the Beacons...Led Illinois State with 142 assists on the season and finished the year with 393 career assists, which ranks 8th in the Redbird record books...Led Illinois State with a 39.3 percent mark from three while making a career-best 42 three pointers...Averaged a career-bests of 11.8 points per game and 4.2 assists per game...Season high 23 points Dec. 19 vs Saint Louis...Season-best 9 assists Feb. 25 vs Evansville.

REDSHIRT JUNIOR YEAR (2022-23): Played in 33 games, with 32 starts, at point guard, averaging 27.4 minutes per contest ... averaged 7.7 points, 3.6 assists, and 2.3 rebounds ... led the team in free throw percentage, shooting 93.7% (74-of-79) from the charity stripe, unofficially second best in the NCAA ... shot 40.6% (73-of-180) from the field and 38.6% (34-of-88) from behind the arc ... had a season-high 16 points at Missouri State on Jan. 5, going 7-of-7 from the charity stripe ... dished out a career-best nine assists versus Drake on Dec. 30 ... tallied double figure scoring in 10 games ... totaled 254 points, 118 assists, 76 rebounds, 24 steals, and five blocks on the year ... member of the first ISU team to win a MVC regular season title since 2010 and the first team to go to three straight postseason tournaments since 2011-13 ... started in ISU's WNIT contest against Missouri on March 16, going for four points and four assists over 37 minutes of action

REDSHIRT SOPHOMORE YEAR (2021-22): Played and started in 32 games at point guard, averaging 30.1 minutes per contest ... almost doubled her production from the year before, averaging 8.6 points, 3.1 assists and 2.4 rebounds ... led the team in free throw percentage, shooting 84.2% (80-of-95) from the free throw line ... shot 41.3% (88-of-213) from the floor and 24.3% (18-of-74) from behind the arc ... had a season-high 17 points vs. Drake on Jan. 29, making a career-best three triples ... had a season-best eight assists at SIUE on Dec. 11 ... played a career-high 38 minutes and put on an impressive defensive performance in ISU's championship game vs. UNI at the MVC Tournament on March 13, going for 15 points while recording four assists and four rebounds ... tallied double figure scoring in 12 contests ... totaled 274 points, 100 assists, 76 rebounds, 11 steals and six blocks on the year ... helped ISU to its first MVC Tournament title in 14 years ... started in #15 Illinois State's First Round NCAA Tournament game versus second-seeded Iowa, played in front of a sold-out crowd of 15,000+ at Carver-Hawkeye Arena on Mar. 18.

REDSHIRT FRESHMAN YEAR (2020-21): Played in all but one game in the 2020-21 campaign, averaging 18.0 minutes per contest ... averaged 6.0 points, 1.5 assists and 1.5 rebounds per game in her first year on the court for the Redbirds ... had a season-high 15 points in ISU's conference opener at UNI (Jan. 1) ... tallied double figure scoring in six contests ... shot 46.2% (43-of-93) from the floor and 35.1% (13-of-37) from behind the three-point line ... was second on the team in free throw percentage, shooting 83.3% (40-of-48) from the charity stripe ... grabbed a season-high five boards at Indiana State (Jan. 7) and dished out a personal-best four assists vs. Omaha (Dec. 17) ... totaled 139 points, 35 rebounds, 34 assists, nine steals and three blocks on the year ... helped ISU make its first postseason appearance in eight years at the WNIT, putting up 12 points and three rebounds in the win over Samford (Mar. 20) to advance the Redbirds to the consolation semifinals in Memphis.

FRESHMAN YEAR (2019-20): Redshirt
